image.longCaption: A view of the SuperSport Park from the stands, South Africa v New Zealand, 2nd Test, Centurion, 2nd day, November 17, 2007

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.commentary: Ricky Ponting c Botha b Steyn 63 (77b 9x4 0x6 118m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: picks out backward point. It was full and wide, Ponting connected quite well but Botha didn't have to move too far to his right

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Clarke run out (Botha) 44 (48b 5x4 2x6 83m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: backing up, what a way to go! We've seen a few of these of late. Ponting used his feet, drilled it down the pitch where Botha got a hand on it and Clarke was backing up well out of his crease
that's a comeback! Steyn strikes. Back on a good length, draws Warner onto the front foot and there's a hint of swing into the left hander which takes the inside edge into leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Hussey b Johnson 27 (20b 3x4 0x6 44m) SR: 135

dismissalComment.html: Faf goes on the attack, but he slices across the attempted loft and the ball loops out to Mike Hussey at deep cover. South Africa sink further. They need to reach 172 by the 20th over to be par on D/L now

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Johan Botha hit wicket b Cummins 25 (22b 3x4 1x6 29m) SR: 113.63

dismissalComment.html: he's trodden on his stumps! Cummins has his third. Early in his career to get a hit wicket. Botha went back and across then pulled a short ball away, but the in process of playing the stroke his back foot when into the base of stumps

Faf goes on the attack, but he slices across the attempted loft and the ball loops out to Mike Hussey at deep cover. South Africa sink further. They need to reach 172 by the 20th over to be par on D/L now

Steyn perishes in search of runs! Johnson pulled his length back and Steyn slashed hard into an uppercut, but could only spoon the ball down to Bollinger at third man. Good catch by the lanky fast bowler, and South Africa lose another one

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's the game! Tsotsobe tries to launch this down the ground but only manages to send it straight up in the air and Marsh steadied himself under the catch back-tracking from mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: big wicket! Cummins keeps taking wickets. It was full outside off, Kallis went for a drive and got a thick inside into the stumps. Not a bad scalp to start your ODI career with
gone! He's got Duminy again. He was trying to pull his bat away from the delivery outside off, but it was too late and it ran off the face to second slip who held a sharp catch.

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's trodden on his stumps! Cummins has his third. Early in his career to get a hit wicket. Botha went back and across then pulled a short ball away, but the in process of playing the stroke his back foot when into the base of stumps

headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bollinger player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith lbw b Bollinger 4 (5b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: gone! Bollinger wins the battle again, Smith plays across the line and is given lbw. Smith considers a review but after asking Amla he walks off. It looked out.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis b Cummins 15 (15b 1x4 1x6 29m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: big wicket! Cummins keeps taking wickets. It was full outside off, Kallis went for a drive and got a thick inside into the stumps. Not a bad scalp to start your ODI career with

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Clarke b Cummins 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: gone! He's got Duminy again. He was trying to pull his bat away from the delivery outside off, but it was too late and it ran off the face to second slip who held a sharp catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Haddin b Marsh 24 (32b 2x4 1x6 45m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: another one goes! And with a fine catch. South Africa falling apart. Was full and fairly wide, Amla chased it and got an edge through to Brad Haddin who took a super catch, one-handed, diving in front of first slip

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Clarke b Doherty 11 (12b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: was this a catch? Miller stepped away and drove hard square of the wicket, the ball landing in point's waiting hands. But was it a bump ball? Doherty appeals but the umpire's not convinced. Eventually they go upstairs, and that's out!

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Boucher lbw b Doherty 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: there's an appeal from Doherty as Boucher misses a flick to leg and is hit on the pads, but it's quickly quashed. How close was this? Doherty doesn't look that confident, but Clarke wants to review it. Yep, it pitched in line and would've taken out middle and leg, Boucher is out!

dismissalText.commentary: Lonwabo Tsotsobe c Marsh b Johnson 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: that's the game! Tsotsobe tries to launch this down the ground but only manages to send it straight up in the air and Marsh steadied himself under the catch back-tracking from mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lonwabo Tsotsobe c Marsh b Johnson 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 44.44

commentTextItems.html: that's the game! Tsotsobe tries to launch this down the ground but only manages to send it straight up in the air and Marsh steadied himself under the catch back-tracking from mid-off

commentPostTextItems.html: Australia win by 93 runs and that's a very convincing performance. They batted positively either side of a long rain break, especially on the resumption, and benefited from the D/L calculation as they'd only lost one wicket before the rain. The target was tough for South Africa and they needed a good start which never came as Graeme Smith's problems continued (although he could have saved himself with a review). Pat Cummins starred again while Xavier Doherty impressed with a good spell. Overall, plenty for Australia to be happy about and much for South Africa to ponder ahead of the next match in Port Elizabeth. We'll be back in less than 12 hours to bring you coverage of India against England but, for now, from Andrew McGlashan and Liam Brickhill - who deserves a special mention for his efforts during that rain break - it's goodnight.

commentTextItems.html: short delivery, Tsotsobe drops his hands and lets it go over the stumps
goes full at the stumps and it's driven to cover
pushed across outside off stump, Tsotsobe stands still and doesn't play a shot
touch shorter and this time it's nicely punched off the back foot wide of cover
full at off stump, hint of shape away to Morkel who drives to cover
back of a length, defended towards gully to end a rapid over

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: slower ball outside off which is steered into the off side
well done by the No. 11. Cummins followed up with a full delivery but Tsotsobe drove it straight down the ground even though he was quite behind the line
that's a quick one but it's too short and climbs clear of the batsman and the keeper
that's an excellent short ball, targets Tsotsobe's throat and he does well to play it down in front of gully
short of a length and it's well played as he defends behind the line

dismissalText.commentary: Johan Botha hit wicket b Cummins 25 (22b 3x4 1x6 29m) SR: 113.63

commentPreTextItems.html: Pat Cummins coming back into the attack

commentTextItems.html: he's trodden on his stumps! Cummins has his third. Early in his career to get a hit wicket. Botha went back and across then pulled a short ball away, but the in process of playing the stroke his back foot when into the base of stumps
heaves a full delivery into the leg side but can't beat a diving mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Doug Bollinger player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Doug Bollinger player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Thanks Liam. Not much left for South Africa

commentTextItems.html: beaten by the bounce as he tries to cut through the off side

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn c Bollinger b Johnson 5 (9b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 55.55

commentTextItems.html: Steyn perishes in search of runs! Johnson pulled his length back and Steyn slashed hard into an uppercut, but could only spoon the ball down to Bollinger at third man. Good catch by the lanky fast bowler, and South Africa lose another one

commentPostTextItems.html: I'll hand over to Andrew McGlashan to take you to the close.

commentTextItems.html: Steyn will keep swinging! He has another go and this time finds the middle, flat-batting a length delivery over mid on after clearing the left leg
Johnson pushes this one slightly wider on the angle across the left-hander, who misses with the cut this time
Steyn doesn't come close to laying bat on ball with a flatfooted swish outside off
Botha on the attack! More length from Bollinger and it's disappeared over wide long on for six. Do South Africa still have a chance? Rusty and Waleed will say they do!

dismissalComment.html: Steyn perishes in search of runs! Johnson pulled his length back and Steyn slashed hard into an uppercut, but could only spoon the ball down to Bollinger at third man. Good catch by the lanky fast bowler, and South Africa lose another one

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel not out 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 50

dismissalText.commentary: Lonwabo Tsotsobe c Marsh b Johnson 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: that's the game! Tsotsobe tries to launch this down the ground but only manages to send it straight up in the air and Marsh steadied himself under the catch back-tracking from mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Bollinger wins the battle again, Smith plays across the line and is given lbw. Smith considers a review but after asking Amla he walks off. It looked out.

Faf goes on the attack, but he slices across the attempted loft and the ball loops out to Mike Hussey at deep cover. South Africa sink further. They need to reach 172 by the 20th over to be par on D/L now

Steyn perishes in search of runs! Johnson pulled his length back and Steyn slashed hard into an uppercut, but could only spoon the ball down to Bollinger at third man. Good catch by the lanky fast bowler, and South Africa lose another one

headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's the game! Tsotsobe tries to launch this down the ground but only manages to send it straight up in the air and Marsh steadied himself under the catch back-tracking from mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: big wicket! Cummins keeps taking wickets. It was full outside off, Kallis went for a drive and got a thick inside into the stumps. Not a bad scalp to start your ODI career with
gone! He's got Duminy again. He was trying to pull his bat away from the delivery outside off, but it was too late and it ran off the face to second slip who held a sharp catch.

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's trodden on his stumps! Cummins has his third. Early in his career to get a hit wicket. Botha went back and across then pulled a short ball away, but the in process of playing the stroke his back foot when into the base of stumps

was this a catch? Miller stepped away and drove hard square of the wicket, the ball landing in point's waiting hands. But was it a bump ball? Doherty appeals but the umpire's not convinced. Eventually they go upstairs, and that's out!

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there's an appeal from Doherty as Boucher misses a flick to leg and is hit on the pads, but it's quickly quashed. How close was this? Doherty doesn't look that confident, but Clarke wants to review it. Yep, it pitched in line and would've taken out middle and leg, Boucher is out!

another one goes! And with a fine catch. South Africa falling apart. Was full and fairly wide, Amla chased it and got an edge through to Brad Haddin who took a super catch, one-handed, diving in front of first slip

notes: Australia innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 53 runs, 1 wicket)
Australia: 50 runs in 9.6 overs (61 balls), Extras 1
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 65 balls (RT Ponting 32, MJ Clarke 20, Ex 1)
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 19.0 (Bowling side - 19 runs, 0 wicket)
Drinks: Australia - 78/1 in 16.0 overs (RT Ponting 33, MJ Clarke 23)
Bad Light: Australia - 96/1 in 19.0 overs (RT Ponting 40, MJ Clarke 29)
Rain: Australia - 96/1 in 19.0 overs (RT Ponting 40, MJ Clarke 29)
Bad Weather: Australia - 96/1 in 19.0 overs (RT Ponting 40, MJ Clarke 29)
Wet Ground: Australia - 96/1 in 19.0 overs (RT Ponting 40, MJ Clarke 29)
Rain: Australia - 96/1 in 19.0 overs (RT Ponting 40, MJ Clarke 29)
21 overs lost
Australia: 100 runs in 19.4 overs (119 balls), Extras 7
RT Ponting: 50 off 60 balls (9 x 4)
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 109 balls (RT Ponting 52, MJ Clarke 44, Ex 6)
Australia: 150 runs in 24.3 overs (148 balls), Extras 8
Innings Break: Australia - 183/4 in 29.0 overs (MEK Hussey 30, MR Marsh 8)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 6.0 (Mandatory - 31 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 6.1 - 9.0 (Bowling side - 21 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 50 runs in 8.3 overs (51 balls), Extras 1
Over 14.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - JD Cloete, Batsman - MV Boucher (Upheld)
Powerplay 3: Overs 17.1 - 20.0 (Batting side - 27 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 100 runs in 18.2 overs (110 balls), Extras 3

stories.title: Australia cruise to win in rain-reduced match
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Australia, 1st ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Australia: Australia cruise to win in rain-reduced match
stories.summary: Australia were inconvenienced more by rain than South Africa as they rampaged through the hosts in a truncated first ODI at Centurion, winning by 93 runs under Duckworth-Lewis calculations

image.caption: Michael Clarke and Ricky Ponting added 102 for the second wicket on either side of the rain break
image.longCaption: Michael Clarke and Ricky Ponting added 102 for the second wicket on either side of the rain break, South Africa v Australia, 1st ODI, Centurion, October 19, 2011
